translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Paduma and Kesara
The Elder Dhammasaññaka’s Birth Story🔽“The Great Awakening
of the Fortunate One Vipassī
was like a tree trunk,
the World’s Chief, the Best of Men.
At that time the Fortunate One,
with the Community of monks in front,
was teaching the Four Truths,

analyzed: vācāsabhim udīraya  saṅkhittena ca desentaḥ  vitthārena ca desaya
translated: with the voice of the best of speakers.🔽Teaching in brief🔽and teaching in detail,
the Awakened One, with his net of doubt cut,
cooled the great people.
Having heard the Dhamma
of the World’s Chief, the One with Suchness,
after worshipping the Teacher’s feet,
I departed facing north.
For ninety-one eons
I have not known a bad destination,🔽this is the fruit of listening to the Dhamma,
the result of the rain of Dhamma.
Thirty-three eons ago
there was a lord of the earth,
called Sutavā by name,
a powerful Universal Monarch.
The four analytical insights,
I have done what the Buddha asked.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā dhammasaññako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā dhammasaññakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: Thus has the venerable Dhamma-sign, the Elder, recited these stanzas.
The Story of the Elder Dhamma-sign, the Fourth.
